{"step_by_step_thinking": "Olympian brown and rhagades are both characteristic findings seen in congenital syphilis. Rhagades are linear scars that can be seen around the mouth, anus, or genitalia in congenital syphilis. CMV inclusion disease is characterized by intra-nuclear and cytoplasmic inclusions in various organs. Ectodermal dysplasia is a genetic disorder that affects the development of the skin, hair, nails, teeth, and sweat glands.
